review:
А еще здесь есть VR, но насколько он хорош - не скажу, потому что у меня нет VR.

Отличная. на мой взгляд, тактическая игра в обертке зомби-апокалипсиса. Сюжет простой, выжившие ищут лекарства, можно не заострять на этом внимание.
В обзорах видел претензии относительно графики, но надо понимать что это такой стиль - как будто ты наблюдаешь со спутника. Довольно много игр такого формата, про некоторые я уже писал в других отзывах. Это 911 Emergency и Radio Commander.  Да и много их. Мне, на самом деле, нравится такой визуал - способствует погружению. будто ты где-то далеко, и можешь только отдавать приказы и понимать - что за иконкой взвода разведчиков, которая только что исчезла с карты, стояли живые люди.

В игре порядка 18 миссий, и они приятно удивят разнообразием - горы, города, пустоши - рельеф потребует от вас грамотного подхода к выбору отрядов, которых возьмете с собой на миссию. А еще есть влияние погодных условий, разрушаемое окружение - да и самих отрядов не меньше 40, так что не поучится сколотить костят их пяти привычных отрядов и проходить ими всю игру. Отряды имебт свои особенности и большой разброс в характеристиках. Если на карте есть много вышек или небоскребов, можно взять снайперов, у которых чем выше позиция, тем дальше стреляют и, в итоге, 3 отряда снайперов будут контролировать всю карту. В то же время, в лесу с парой домиков от них никакого толку, зато не помешают штурмовики и быстроходные хамви. И так далее. Состав постоянно придется менять.

И за фоновые звуки без раздумий поставлю 10/10. Игра отлично сделана и о потраченном времени не жалею.

review:
Глядя на смешанные обзоры, не могу удержаться от того, чтобы, наконец, по достоинству оценить эту игру.
ZCD2 это синглплеерная помесь RTT и TD. Вы руководите группой людей разной степени вооружённости и проходите миссии разного рода. В качестве противника выступают разнообразные зомби - то, что они разнообразные это хорошо, то что зомби - не очень. По итогу именно зомби-тематика определяет степень тавердефенсности игры.
Тем не менее, игра предоставляет обширный набор разнообразных подразделений для найма, пассивных улучшений либо активных улучшений построек. Каждая миссия представляет собой специфическую карту с довольно ограниченными ресурсами - где-то больше гаек, где-то хавчика, где-то пилюль, а где-то - людей. Каждое подразделение требует людей и материалов для найма, питания для полноценного функционирования, и лекарств чтоб не откинуться. На картах можно встретить фермы и заводы, где что-то из ресурсов можно вырабатывать бесконечно (людей это не касается), и есть домики с небольшим запасом барахла, которое можно собрать. И вот в сочетании почти полной безграничности опций и ограниченности ресурсов и есть вся прелесть игры. На одной карте с ресурсами всё неплохо, а сторожевые вышки позволяют долго отбиваться от накатов зомбей. На другой - отравленные территории, где пехоте фу, а технике норм. Где-то эту пехоту тупо не нанять из-за отсутствия казарм как факта (а значит с захватом зданий будет непросто). Где-то можно выбомбить мосты, чтоб зомбям пришлось топать по дну, но это сделает невозможным захват больших производственных мощностей.
Открывая и выбирая юниты и способности можно проходить миссии совершенно по-разному и это довольно интересно.
В тактическом плане игра одна из лучших за последние годы, однако сеттинг и синглплеерность, на мой взгляд, не дали ей полноценно расцвести. Тем не менее она безусловно заслуживает внимания.

review:
게임 시작 하면 스페이스나 1번 눌러서 게임 멈추고 맵 주요 시설 찾으삼. 그리고 1~2개 정도 선정하고 라이플 스쿼드 2~3개 뽑고 ㅈㄴ 달리삼. 그와 동시에 엔지니어 뽑아서 공장에 넣어주거나 본부에 방탄복? 같은애 빼고 넣어주면 됨. 이거 본부에 넣어주는것도 (초반에)중요한게 본부에서 식량도 생산해서 본부에 엔지니어 넣어주면 식량 부족한 타이밍 늦춰줌. 물론 러쉬가는데 조금 부담이 되긴 하지만 그건 켐페인 후반에 돌아봐야 알겠지만 초반엔 이거 다먹힘.



유닛이나 스킬이런거 추천해주면
INFANTRY 보병은 scout, Rifleman, AT, Flamethower 
스카웃은 스케빈저용임. 탐색이 크게 필요 없는 맵들에서는 안쓰는데 도시형 맵에서는 잘써주면 맵 다먹음. 게다가 큰맵은 자원이랑 인구가 같이 빨리 들어와야 하는것도 큰데 스카웃으로 어느정도 빠르게 수급가능함.

라이플은 유틸임. 속도 빠르고 데미지 적당하고 싸고 인구 그나마 덜먹어서 시작하자마자 달리기 최고인 유닛이고 웨이브 지나서는 장거리 몹들 자르기 엄청 좋음. 애 다음은 마크맨보다 사거리는 짧아도 공격력은 비슷하고 체력 높고 싸서 더 많이 쓰게 됨.

AT(안티탱크)는 초반에 단단한좀비 잘잡고 사거리도 좋아서 원거리 잘 때려잡음. 하지만 RPG Turret이 인구도 안잡아먹고 데미지도 좋고 심지어 싸기까지 해서 캠페인 초반에만 쓰고 나중엔 안씀.

화염방사기는 노업상태에서도 잡몹 잘 쓸어담고 건물 내부 클리어 개잘함 거기다 단단함. 대신 느리고 후반엔 플레임터렛이 잡몹 쓸어담고, 풀업라이플이 내부클리어는 그냥 쌈싸먹어서 그닥...

그리고 머신건은 쓰지마삼... 개 물몸이고 느려서 애들 피하기도 힘듬. 쓰는 방법이 있긴한데 Ctrl + z 누르면 건물 강제어택 가능해서 유닛 소환하는 코쿤 있는 건물 원거리에서 파괴가능. 근데 이것마저 쓰기 어려움. 그냥 라이플 뽑아서 풀업시켜주삼.
 


VEHICLES 탈것
애들은 많이 안쓰고 3개만 사용했음. Machine gun turret, RPG turret, Flame turret이 좋음
5단계 1난이도라도 깨려면 RPG turret은 있어야함.
그리고 저 3개는 인구 적게 먹어서 좋으니 유용하게 쓰임.



어빌리티는 Napalm이 제일 좋고  그 다음은 Airstrike 좋음. 
맵에 따라서 Blockbuster 써야함. 애가 건물 1방에 터뜨릴수 있어서 빠르게 몇 군대 점령하려면 거의 필수



UPGRADE는 나중에 하나도 안쓰지만 초반에는 Expansion가 유용함.
이게 뭐냐면 건물에 1유닛 더 들어가게 해줌.
공장이나 본부에도 1명 더 들어가게 해주면 생산량 늘어남. 근데 왠만하면 엔지니어 업하면 그냥 자원 더 많이 캐니 이거 들고가는것보다는 엔지니어 업해주는게 더 좋음. 
그런데 이게 좋은게 고층 터렛에도 1명 더 넣을수 있어서, 1단계 맵에서 INFITE 모드로 하고 협곡에 있는 고층 타워 3개에 Expansion 쓰고 AT 스쿼드 총 6개 넣고 본부 근처에 방어진 치면 100라운드 까지 버팀. 이거하면 1만 포인트 주니 유용하게 써보삼.



PERK는  
Heavy amour랑 light amour 동시에 쓰면 4점 추가로 줌. 
쓰는게 아니라 주는거임. 그리고 비는거 Light Engineer training 넣어주니 꽤 쓸만함. 
Reduced rations이랑 Increase rations도 서로 상쇄되니 두개 찍고 1점 더 받아가삼. 
그리고 Deployment training 이거는 포탑 많이쓰면 거의 필수인데 포탑이 딱히 유동적으로 안움직여도 되는 맵이 있음. 진짜 단순하지만 먹을건 없는 그런 맵들.... 이럴땐 안써도 됨. 어차피 포탑 박으면 이동안해서 상관없음.


스테이지 공략은
2단계는 위에 민가에 잘보면 땅을 바이오하자드 마크 있음. 여기 들어가면 ㅈ되니 그냥 인구많은집만 들어가면됨.
2단계 초반에 시작해서 엔지니어 2마리 뽑고 라이플 스쿼드 2마리 뽑고 라이플 스쿼드 1마리는 2업해주고 바로 인구많은집으로 ㅈㄴ 달리면됨. 그 후에 엔지니어도 업글해주면 그러면 어찌저찌됨. 
이거 바이오하자드 마크 없애려면 공장 파괴해야하는데 공장 파괴하려면 기관총 스쿼드+ 라이플스쿼드 2개 있는 상태에서 사막쪽으로 돌아가서 파괴해야함. 안그럼 공중폭격 스킬쓰면 되는데 초반에 이거 얻는사람 거의 없으니 그냥 가서 파괴하거나 나~~중에 다시하면 폭격때리삼. 


4단계도 문젠데 4단계는 초반에 라이플2에 기관총1써서 라이플 한마리로는 스케빈저하고 라이플 1마리랑 기관총 1마리로 코쿤 파괴하면됨. 코쿤이 공장에서 계속 몹들 스폰하는데 ctrl+z 누르면 공장 강제 어택 되니 라이플은 기관총이 물몸이니 조금 앞에서 지키고 기관총은 코쿤있는 건물 파괴하면됨.
또 코쿤 있는 건물 파괴안하고 코쿤만 파괴하려면 화염방사기스쿼드 있어야함. 코쿤은 불공격하고 화염방사기 스쿼드는 불면역이라서 쉽게 잡긴함. 근데 이거 쓰고 코쿤 죽이로 들어가는게 애들이 너무 느려서 힘듬. 그리고 이것도 힘든데 들어가서 생산하는건 훨씬 힘듬. 처음엔 실력 안되니 그냥 건물채로 파괴하는게 정신건강에 좋음. 그리고 실력 어느정도 쌓이면 그때 이짓해서 업적하면 됨.


5단계는 본부에 방역복? 그놈 1마리 뽑고 ㅈㄴ 달려서 인구많은집이랑 탈것 생산하는 공장 먹으면됨. 그리고 생산 하면되는데 머신건 터렛이랑 RPG 터렛만 있어도 쉽게함.
그리고 이쯤부터 보라색 투사채로 가시 쏘는애 나오는데 이놈은 라이플로 강제어택 해줘야하는데 5단계에서 라이플 뽑을 실력이면 포탑으로도 처리가능함.


6단계 시작하자마자 본부에 방역복 유닛 왼쪽위에 파밍하고 라이플이나 스카웃 뽑아서 위쪽에 인구많은 건물로 달려야함. 1마리 더뽑아서 왼쪽위 파밍 시키면 됨. 그리고 만약 blockbuster 있으면 그걸로 바이러스 라는 명칭 들어간 건물 깨주면 되고 없으면 힘들게 돌아가서 기관총으로 깨야함. 코쿤들은 라이플 만렙찍으면 라이플끼리 돌아가면서 깨주면 됨. 화방으로 깨기엔 맵 자체 날씨디버프+산림지대 디버프로 속도가 진~~짜 느림.


7단계가 이상하게 어려운데 방법은 역시 시작하자 마자 달리는거임. 본부에 방역복 유닛 어차피 생산에 도움 안되니 바로 아래 마을로 달리고 엔지니어 3마리 라이플2마리 뽑아서 한꺼번에 가는게 아니라 뽑히는 대로 다리건너로 달림. 엔지는 생산건물에 넣고 라이플은  인구건물에 넣으면됨. 여기서  spore는 공격하는애가 아니라 적군 버프 주는애라서 딱히 신경 안써도됨. fire zombie 인가 걔도 다리위는 못때리고 잘 우회하면 못때림. 이맵은 AT 스쿼드도 필요한데 몇 웨이브 안되서 특수 어보미네이션이 나옴. 이 놈이 진짜쌤. 만약 네이팜 스킬 있으면 네이팜 떨궈주고 라이플로 잡아도 되는데 중반에도 또나오는데 걔를 잡기힘듬.

이정도 깨면 대충 게임 감잡을거임.







공략 유용하게 써라.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110054641', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1614838670}
review:
Would I recommend this?
Short answer, no.


The game leaves MUCH to be desired, from actual frame rate handling, to gameplay being assenine in every way possible.
First off, I'm running the game with a quad core Ryzen 5 2600, and a GTX 1050, and I get this weird/stupid frame skips, which not only get annoying over time, but cause my camera to yeet itself on the other side of the map at the worst time. 

Secondly, gameplay. You've probably seen the most Non Recommended helpful views say how balance doesn't exist, and pathfinding/zombie mechanics are horrendous, they are. Let's start off, I will be grabbing a part of someone's review for example. (Credit to FicusCat.)

The first mission, FIRST MISSION, requires you to defend, and use 3 towers in your 'base', yet not only do you have a problem managing the abysmal 'pop' system, you have to manage the fact zombies can just plug walk to what ever building they want, instead of what's shooting at them. Causing your engineers to possibly die, so you lose resources, thus losing the mission. 

Want an even worse one? Mission 2, where you're so limited on food, you'll most likely run out on your first run, because the game doesn't teach you, that food comes from your HQ as well as food production buildings.
Not only that, but it throws an extremely tanky, and bullshit 'spore' unit, that will mulch right through your base, if you don't get to the oil derrick to your left, and snipe it early on.

Mission 3, not as bad, easy to defend and you rely on turrets a lot, no complaints. (Mission 4 is hard, but not as bad as the next. hahahaha)

Oh dear god mission 5 though. WHO IN THE FLYING HELL, decided not giving a troop building, or ways to manage easily, on the EASIEST difficulty would be a good idea. Thus my rant, I've grinded for nearly 4 of my 5 hours played. Just to get a RPG turret to defend me, oh guess what, you get rushed by a bunch of level 5 units and it melts instantly. Oh i just lost.. oh.... 


Rant over with. This game's concept is good, but horrendously misguided, and not developed well. 
If some zombies weren't so bullshit tanky, it wouldn't be a problem. Hell, maybe even add a priority box, so my RPG's don't shoot a level 1 zombie instead of the giant tank like one that can melt my units in 3 seconds flat. 
My point being, it's fun for it's concept, but later missions are just stupid, and require you to know exactly how the developer *Wanted* you to play, not giving options to experiment, and make some interesting defenses.

My rant is over, is this game worth the price? At $10 USD, no... not even close

On a 75% deal, i leave that up to you. Now if you'll excuse me, i'm going to forget my 4 hours of suffering that amounted to nothing.

3/10 Gameplay
6/10 Graphics
7/10 Concept
2/10 Fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198075324976', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 6144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1592103430}
review:
"Select this building and click the icon"

Which building? There's like 10 and they all look the same and nothing is labeled.

What icon? My interface is covered in tiny icons, none of them labeled, nothing marked.

The interface is a sloppy mess, sure you can figure it out, but there's no excuse for how bad it is right from the start. Even the tutorial assumes you already know what all the buttons are. Well no, I don't know what the buttons are and that's why I'm playing the tutorial you freaking Muppet. When you make a sloppy cluttered interface where everything looks the same, you either provide a tutorial that shows you what the buttons do, or just get out of my way and let me figure it out on my own.

Nope, this gives you a sloppy interface and then gets in your way with instructions that don't bother to instruct you how to use anything correctly.

Fine, skip your useless tutorial, I'll figured it out myself. 

Wait, this is it? This is the entire game? The least interesting part of an RTS followed by the slowest Tower Defense combat I've seen in a while?

This is some attempt at a hybrid mashup of RTS base building mixed with tower defense wait and hope combat mechanics. It certainly thinks it's clever and maybe there was a good idea in here somewhere; but it got lost under the terrible interface, the awkward clutter of buildings that all look alike and a souless attempt at humor with some of the cheesiest voice acting to come out in recent years.

Click on an enemy unit and you get some child going "grrr" at you, as if you are supposed to be afraid of an 8 year old girl who thinks she's a scary zombie.

Click on one of your own units and you'll get a rotating set of generic uninspired one liners that sound like they were recorded as filler but accidently left in the game when they ran out of budget to hire voice actors.

I've played for all of 10 minutes and I've already heard the same squeaky child say "yes commander" more than 100 times for every possible action.

As a concept this probably had potential, but it's very poorly executed and with such lackluster production quality that it just doesn't hold my attention at all. 

If you catch it on sale for $1 or less and hate yourself, go for it, but honestly you can find free games better than this. Not worth anywhere near its full $10 asking price.

I got this as part of a bundle so I don't feel too ripped off, but I can't recommend bothering to buy it on purpose.
---

EDIT: Take a look at the achievements, less than 2% of owners have bothered to complete the final mission, more than 98% of owners abandoned this game. There's your real review.
---

EDIT 2: I can force myself to finish the game, but I can't force myself to like it. Many hours later my only regret was wasting the time to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967223692', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1536359615}
review:
I don't think I would really call this a tower defense game. It is honestly more of an RTS. The only sort of thing in this that is even somewhat like a tower defense is that you can lock down turrets and vehicles like artillary, and garrison buildings with infantry, but you can do that in plenty of RTS games. The zombies can attack your units and the buildings they are in, unlike in most tower defense games where your towers or units are fairly untouchable. This honestly kind of reminds me of RTS games like Command and Conquer Generals. Don't get me wrong, this game is nowhere near as good as Generals, nowhere, but the units, the resource collecting, the time period, the technology, the faction abilities; all feel a lot like the USA defending against the GLA.

You can't see your units other than an icon, making it hard to tell if they are inside a building that can be garrisoned by multiple units, or beside it. The different resources and how you have to collect them is really quite tedious, it should have been done better, especially for a 'tower defense' game. The UI and the HUD is terrible, and moving around units just feels bad. The mechanics are annoying, and the controls are just bad. Playing this game just leaves a sour taste in my mouth, because I can see how it could have been good, but it just didn't get there. That and it just gets boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007223119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 2183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1945, 'last_played': 1536147609}
review:
In dem Spiel kämpft Masse gegen Klasse. Wer wird gewinnen? Basismanagement, -verteidigung, Resourcensammeln und Zombievernichtung in einem Spiel. Grafik ist futuristisch gehalten und auf das wesentliche beschränkt. Der Sound ist ebenso simpel wie passend. Im VR-Modus übernimmt die Brille die Funktion der Maus und mit dem Controller wählt man die jeweilige Einheit (das jeweilige Gebäude) aus und gibt Anweisungen.
Das ganze funktioniert im allgemeinen recht gut. Nur bei vielen Einheiten an einem Ort kann die Auswahl etwas fummelig werden. Alles in Allem ein recht brauchbarer VR-Strategie Titel. Für 9,99 ein gutesVR-Strategiespiel. Da es sonst nicht all zu viele Strategiespiele in VR gibt, ist es auf alle Fälle für Strategiefreunde mit VR-Brille einen Blick wert ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198059419835', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1527222495}
review:
Средненькая тактическая стратежка в режиме реального времени... В ней нет как таковой графики: всё абстрактно и состоит из циферок, да надписей...
И в этом всём удивляешься - КАК ЭТО МОЖЕТ ТОРМОЗИТЬ?! Оптимизация на уровне... Чувство, будто это какой-то 3D-тест для твоей [spoiler]мамки[/spoiler] видеокарты... 
Еще из минусов - устают глаза от такого визуального стиля. Но если не отвлекаться
на эту составляющую, то это вполне заставляющая тебя думать игра с очень разнообразынми уровнями и юнитами. Если ты прошел миссию по одной стратегии, то вторую ты уже так не пройдешь, приходится шевелить своими мозгами. За выполнение миссий ты получаешь специальные очки, которые можно потратить на открытие разных юнитов и улучшений, чтоб взять их на следующее задание. author: {'steamid': '76561198064593529', 'num_games_owned': 1367, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1529429807}
review:
It's incredibly frustrating with fake difficulty. It's not really about strategy so much as it's about finding the specific way the developer designed the level to be beaten. You try a strategy you think will work, and it goes horrible, so you try something different, and it goes slightly less terrible. You keep doing this until you realize what works. For example, this level, I've realized flamethrowers are the necessary weapon, so I use them, and still die near the end, even though I had built up defenses. So now I know I need to use flamethrowers to take things over in this level, and then I need to use something else to hold off the last enemy wave. The strategies employed don't really make sense, even after discovering them. It's really just a hit and miss sort of game where you fail a bunch of times until you hit the sweet spot of taking the exact actions you're supposed to take.
I usually really like RTS games, and basically any strategy game, or game that's really difficult. This isn't really any of those things though. It's more of a puzzle game in that sense, where you're just trying to find the right combo that will do the trick.

Also, everything requires constant attention. You might have a super good setup to defend a building, but all it takes is one or two little units to be out of reach, and you're units all die (which is a big deal in this game). And it's not even like you just didn't prepare enough. The game mechanics are really weird, so a unit can be technically in your range, but your guy won't shoot at the zombie, because it's on a different floor or something. Also, zombies can use ranged attacks from outside buildings, to hit guys in the building, which is weird. Just lots of little mechanics like this that don't really make any sense, and it ends up requiring a LOT of micro management. Make sure everyone is okay, let 10 seconds of time go by, then pause, and check on everyone again. If you forget to do that, BAM, you just lost the entire level because a few units died and now you won't have enough man power. For example, I just did a level where everything was going amazing. I was checking every little thing, meticulously (or so I thought). Then randomly I get a FAILED in my face. Why? Because a few random zombies walked past all my defenses (which they can do btw, no way to prevent it), then got to my main building, which I guess didn't have enough defenses, or the zombies were just out of reach again, and they killed my main guy. So that's a wasted half hour, not because my strategy was bad, but because of a random little slip up and bad game mechanics.

The graphics are kind of cool, but they haven't really been implemented very well. The city looks awesome, but all the units are really just flags. Every unit (including vehicles) are only a tiny dot on the map, so in order to tell what it is, you have a line going from the unit, with a flag on the end of it. It's just not very immersive because of this. You don't really feel like you're controlling an army.

review:
This game is a very odd mix of RTS and TD, and I love it. The minimalistic artstyle, the way the units are represented, the terrain, everything just gives off one of two feelings, them being 1) virtual simulation for any impending scenario like this, or 2) drone feed the General (you) is using to survey the battlefield.

However, this game is hard as nails until you truly learn the game's ideal gameplay, for the following reasons:
  -You need to have proper sightlines with units in buildings or they won't fire.
  -Friendly fire is a wonderful addition that makes it feel more realistic and, honestly, actually playable as a strategy game.
  -As the levels progress, the enemy units "level up" as well as increase. It's a mix of quality and quantity that is insidiously hard unless you make a masterfully-created defense.
  -You aren't given mercy. This game's first mission is your trip feet first into infected hell. Imagine being an ODST from Halo and being dropped in mid-skirmish. There's the first mission. It gets worse from there.

It's very rewarding to progress, and the "grind" isn't bad whatsoever like what half the negative reviews complain about. You don't even need really good units, you just need proper upgrades and placements of units.

10/10, gives a twist on "zombie defense" strategy games.

The gameplay is great and the aesthetics are very different from  other RTSes that I've played, very minimalist in many ways, but that's not a bad thing. It actually enhances the feel of the game.

The only criticisms that I would have is that the tutorial is a bit sparse on the issue of advancement. I had to kind of figure out on my own through some poking around exactly how to unlock new areas for play. I think maybe a few windows on the selection screen to help you figure out what everything is and how to unlock new areas would be useful to new players.

It's NOT a tower defense, it's a RTS.
The graphic style make it really hard to select your units, especially in a building full of zombies. That graphic style make it even harder to see if your troops are firing on something when it's raining or snowing ( yeah, small white dots in the middle of a bunch of white rain/snow dots aren't that noticeable ).

The range and line of sight mechanic is confusing. Even on the tallest tower you can't shoot most things. A small house can block your whole line of sight which is problematic when all the maps are really cluttered. Yes you can destroy some of these obstacles. IF you don't care about scavenging these obstacles and can spare to create one of the few means to destroy houses. And even when everything is destroyed your line of sight isn't always cleared. 

The weather could be a nice touch. If the malus weren't so huge and always against you. Night fights screw your range, same for fog, rain or snow. But you always fight with that crap weather! More than half your playtime you will play with crippled troops because of the weather.

The levels are poorly designed. Zombies come from everywhere with huges mixed numbers of troops. And trying to destroy a huge wave of ultrazeds with AT troops destroying my own defenses because zeds keep on piling on my factories get old really fast.
A proof that the levels are ill-designed : in the first level, there is 3 defensives towers over the main attack road of the zombies. Even with long ranged troop the line of sight isn't clear enough to hit the zeds more than a couple times, what is the point of these if you can't use them ON THE FIRST MISSION?

The game got a " bunch " of troops and stuff to deal with the zeds but ... you can't use everything and everything is locked at first. And most levels require a precise set of troops to be won. So if you buy the wrong upgrade, be ready to grind the same first level for some time just to get some more TP. As for what you can bring in a level, you get 15 points at the start of each level. With these 15 points you need to choose between 15 differents infantry type ( 3pts average ); 17 differents vehicles/turrets/droids ( 2 pts average ); 9 abilities/spells ( 3 pts average ); 7 batiments upgrade ( 3 pts average ) and a list of perks/flaws. 
A lot of choice, right? Not really because you will never use what you want because of this 15 points limits and the level design of the missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981228012', 'num_games_owned': 15889, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1494615296}
review:
[b]Zombie City Defense 2[/b] - необычная игра, из смеси жанров Tower Defence и RTS. В отличии от классических игр жанра Tower Defence противники двигаются\атакуют не по строго определенным путям. В свою очередь вы можете поставить турели или юниты, там, где вам будет удобно.
По сюжету человечество находится на грани вымирания. Появился вирус, который превращает людей в зомби-монстров. Вам предстоит на протяжении нескольких миссий выживать и защищать разные базы. При защите базы нужно продержаться 15 дней. С каждым днем монстров становится больше, плюс появляются их более продвинуты варианты. Чтобы все этому противостоять, от вас потребуется собирать ресурсы, захватывать здания, создавать технику и турели, обучать пехотинцев различных специализаций (скауты, штурмовики, гранатометчики, медики), а также как можно более эффективно использовать рельеф местности и сооружения.
Zombie City Defense 2 очень необычно выглядит. Разработчики игры с помощью специального фильтра стилизовали картинку игры под инфракрасную камеру дрона. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=900727406

Плюсы
[*]Приятная и стильная минималистичная картинка.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=900727454
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=900727480
[*]Атмосферное музыкальное и звуковое сопровождение.
[*]Легко освоить. При начале игры есть обучающая миссия в которой объясняют общие принципы управления базой и юнитами.
[*]Достижения steam.
[*]Игра имеет русскую локализацию.[/list]

Минусы[list]
[*]Юниты и враги представлены просто иконками. Вероятно, такой минимализм не всем понравиться, т.к. такие юниты неудобны для выделения, особенно на базе.
[*]Через меню игры нельзя сделать рестарт миссии. При нажатии на Esc игра не ставиться на паузу[/list]

Игра вам может показаться слишком сложной, не забывайте апгрейдить юниты.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173840515', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1558777092}
review:
generally, game can be described as a "mixture of real-time strategy and tower defence". but - there are lots of different games that try hard to mix this genres, this mixture of this genres itself is natural and unevoidable, as every rts has moments when you just defend your base.

first thing you see is UI. there are not that many games where UI should be touched while reviewing, but Zombie Defence 2 is especial - it greets you with the UI that is just unbeliavable - pehaps the only place where you can see something similar will be the movies about future - i remember Oblivion with Tom Cruise where i examined the interfaces they've made for some "control everything on a planet system"

second is a great tutorial that learns you how to play a game - its quite required, because game's graphics is designed in same futuristic way where absolutely everything redundant is taken away, every unit, structure are as clean and minimal and iconic as they can only be - it really looks like you are playing from space.

and third - game process itself. on one hand you have the base you can meet in any rts that  you are developing, building units, upgrading etc; on other hands you have enemies attacking as in every tower defence.
but you have lots on top of it: you can scavenge - a feature that is not characteristic for both rts and tower defence; you can ruin any building you see in a game, so you can form a landscape for you to protect it better, and again, i need to say, this feature is not characteristic for most both tower defence and rtc games.

game presents really unique experience, i just don't remember any similar one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994109359', 'num_games_owned': 1874, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1489740523}
review:
Well, I don't have a lot of time with this game yet, but it is such a great concept i had to post something now while it's on sale. There's not a whole lot to the game, but it's polished and fun to play! It's very well thought out and balanced. It's a lot like the movie "The Raven", with Boris Karloff and Vincent Price! It's basically one-on-one, head-to-head magic user battles! 

I recommend this game to anyone that likes magic and fierce battles like in the movie; "The Raven".

My main reason for this prematue review is to let OS X user's know this games works great on my MacBook Pro. I will update this once I play more.

PROS:

+10 different magic user's to level up and build to your liking.

+Nice character customization with skill trees for each one.

+Each character is different and has their own special skills.

+Many different spells to use and stack to make them stronger.

+Different types of spells including damage based, protection, summoning, etc.

+The whole UI fits on one page during battles. No needs to change screens during battle.

+Great descriptions of everything! You can right-click on anything to get a detailed description of what it is and what it does.

+Indepth tutorial! A little confusing at times, but it corrects you too! Oh boy does it correct you! lol 

+The ability to queue up spells for strategic attacks and defense. You can also remove spells from your queue to change strategy on the fly.

+Simple but very strategic gameplay.


CONS:

-You cannot name your character.

-The tutorial was a bit confusing, but that was probably my fault. I'm getting old.

-The game had one bug so far. After completing the first tutorial battle, I went to the main menu and viewed my Grimoire, which is basically your progress screen. My "Wins" score was incorrect.

-There is an age limit (I think 50 years) where you must fight the final boss. I guess the game ends then. Not sure. Each battle is a year. So 50 battles it's bad I guess. There are 10 characters to build up, so it has replayability.

-Not much of a story, but this games doesn't really require one! Just battle it out! :-)

review:
Zombie City Defense is not a ordinary TD game.

This game is a mix of TD and RTS genres. You defend a base. You recruit engineers to increase resources income. There are 4 types of resources. When you have enough resources you can recruit new defensive units. Every unit can be upgraded a lot of times.

You must defend the base for 15 days. Zombies arrives with higher numbers every day. So. the rules are simple. 1) Gather resources 2) Recruit units 3) Defend the base.

The visual deisgn looks nice but it's getting annoying very soon. I found this minimalistics icons instead of real models for units and zombies are really unpleasant. I don't like to peer in the screen to undestand which type of zombie attack me right now. 

Music and sounds are good. There are voice acting also.

The main reason i gave this game a negative review is that it crashed my PC 3 times for 30 minutes. I have got a Kaspersky warning when i made an 4th attempt. I wrote a message in a game group about my problem. Five days has passed. Still no response from the developer.  The last update was 5 months ago. Looks like the game is abandoned.

I can't recommend this game because it crashes and developers are not willing to fix this.
developer_response: Hi! I've tried to fix this but this problem seem to have some other roots than code. Maybe it's Kaspersky or some other system problems. Also project is not abandoned - i'll update the game to the new engine as soon as i'll have time for this (and maybe it'll fix your issue). An update will be available in the beta channel during the next month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046747192', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 3018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1619101224}
review:
This hybrid of genres between tower defense and RTS and zombie survival game is fantastic.

All these genres have their downsides but thanks to the mixture they are negated and instead the aspects that make each of the genres great really shines in here.

Like RTS games often suffer from too much micro but are great fun for playing tactical and thinking out your strategy.

Tower Defense games are often a bit too passive, like there's not enough interaction. Thanks to the units and the buildings that you occupy and upgrade and the looting and so on it gives it the much needed interactivity from the player.

The zombie apocalypse theme fits this genre very well. You need a sort of dumb hord like opponent that tries to overwhelm you. There is no other scenario where the scavenging and looting of buildings could be added. Perhaps aliens could of have offered a bit more like using vehicles.

The game does many thigns right that other great TD games also do well. Like having various difficulty levels with harder objectives to come back to later. Also the armory where you can decide what units and abilities and vehicles and upgrades to bring with you into battle and havign to unlock them.

The ressource system is also great. Food Medicine Material People. I am really glad that the game does not have Ammo as a ressource. it would be realistic if units could run out of ammo but it would also be very tedious and frustrating. Perhaps in an even higher difficulty Ammo could be added.

I'd really like to see a coop mode or perhaps even MP for the next game or added here as an expansion.

I recommend that you check the game out and give it a try. For the price they ask for its absolutely worth it.

review:
Disclaimer: I was given a free Steam key of this game via Keymailer for review purposes. I will feature my video on Zombie City Defense 2 below, but here are, in short, my thoughts:

Positives:

-Unique blend of RTS and tower defense gameplay mechanics
-Beautiful top-down style
-Challenging gameplay, with a strong focus on strategic combat and resource gathering.

Negatives:
-Repetative missions (or levels) with not enough variety.
-All in-game units, friendly and enemies alike, appear as small dots,
making it difficult, at moments, to give your unit orders when they are being surrounded by enemies,
as you'll often be accidentally clicking on the enemy units instead of your own.

Overall: It's a worthy game, although its most glaring drawback is that, at many points,
the game seems unsure whether it wants to be an RTS, or a tower defense game.
The mesh of the two genres, while creative, can at times feel forced and clunky.

Recommendations to the developer:
-Make it easier to instantly assume control of friendly units via an on-screen option or key command, instead of having players rely exclusively on the mouse to find and click on units.
-Add different types of missions, with different strategies. For example, it'd be cool to see more "escort" type missions, where you have to escort your general from one base to another safer base, and use your units to scout ahead and elimate threats from behind and in front. This is just a suggestion, to change things up, nothing more.

You can find my full thoughts in my game review video below:
https://youtu.be/S_-cLiLdN6k

author: {'steamid': '76561198014166179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2105, 'last_played': 1474601218}
review:
Zombie City Defense is a combination RTS and tower defense game with a minimalist drones-eye aesthetic. The concept is adapted from a cell phone game that was a bit too long winded for the platform. The PC version, however is really very challenging and fun.

The game features unlockable levels that increase in difficulty and will require more refined tactics and unit choice to complete. After each level you earn points you can spend unlocking different unit types. Each mission you can spend 15 points to use activating unit cards to bring into the fight, for example you might have to choose between bringing heavy tanks with high damage and range and bringing several more generalized infantry or drones.

Because unit selection is locked behind an unlock system, sometimes you will have to replay a previous level to get more TP for unlocks and it may not be obvious the first game which units will do the best on a particular mission, or you may need to save up to unlock more specialized units.

Missions are meant to be replayed, with three difficulty modes offering increasing rewards and optional objectives as well as an infinite mode. The gameplay can be really dynamic and tower defense tactics of stationary defenses isn't always the best strategy. On some maps roving platoons of infantry make for an easy win while on others tanks and fast attack humvee's have an advantage. 

The game is under active continued development and the Dev is active on the forums and is actively fixing bugs and listening to player feedback and has said there are more levels in the works for the future. so far I'm 30 hrs in and I've unlocked 9 levels and beaten the hardcore mode on 6 of those. It's a game with a surprising amount going on where your ability to manage the economy and make good decisions on the placement and composition of your force matters.

review:
Zombie City Defense 2 is a real-time zombie-defence strategy. As ususal humanity is nearly wiped out by zombies and the only hope of humanity is Iron Corps, which is trying to gather resources, manpower and information about the zombie plague and it's cure.

The game uses unit icons instead of models and simplified textures for buildings and environment, so you may be confused by number of icons a bit at first,  but after several missions you'll get used to it. 

The pros of the game:
+ nice game concept
+ several difficulties
+ a variety of units, buildings, upgrades, enemies
+ faction customization
+ destructable environment
+ steam achievments and collecting cards

The cons:
- some unit icons are easily mixed at first
- complicated gameplay at the beginning

I liked the game and recommend it to real-time strategy fans as well as zombie-defence fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008084834', 'num_games_owned': 6185, 'num_reviews': 502, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1472148731}
review:
Весьма достойно и качественно сделанная игра, в которой вам придётся защищаться от толп заражённых монстров. Для этого вам даётся весьма богатый выбор средств - хотите стойте защитные турели, хотите используйте пехоту, располагая её в зданиях и на местности, а хотите - различную технику, как лёгкую, так и тяжёлую (да-да, раскатайте зомби лобовой танковой атакой :) ). Большинство заданий основаны на том, что надо продержаться какое-то время, не дав убить своего главнокомандующего и не дав уничтожить важные объекты. Но не стоит расслабляться - с каждым прожитым днём атаки орд зомби становятся сильней, орды становятся более многочисленными, а монстры более сильными и разнообразными.

Графика игры весьма порадовала - просто и со вкусом.

review: Zombie City Defense 2 - отличная стратегия, в которой очень хорошо выдерживается атмосфера Зомби Апокалипсиса. Игра разделена на 16 миссий, в каждой из которой нам необходимо продержаться определенное время, дабы более приблизиться к нашей главной цели - выработке вакцины. В это же время нашими оппонентами будут орды зомби, которые к тому же становятся сильнее ночью. Однако не только зомби могут быть нашими врагами, всю нашу стратегию может пустить под хвост простая перемена погоды. Необходимо очень быстро принимать решения в масштабных боях с мертвецами. Графика очень впечатляет, хотелось бы увидеть все через шлем виртуальной реальности, но пока не судьба :( Вид разрушений зданий доставит вам уйму удовольствия. Игра имеет поддержку геймпада и русский интерфейс. Незабвенные карты и достижения -тоже есть. Данный продукт стоит своих денег.

review: Zombie City Defense 2 - отличная стратегия в реальном времени.В этой игре нашим главным врагом на самом деле будут не зомби, а само время. Ведь нам нужно продержаться и оборонятся от ходячих мертвецов определенный временной интервал. Игра изобилует различными видами сооружений, техники,пехоты и даже зомби :Р Учитывать тут стоит все, от рельефа местности,погодных условий и до смены дня/ночи. Порадовала очень графическая составляющая игры, все разрушения объектов выглядят очень зрелищно, при этом не требуя чего то особенного от компьютерного железа.Присутствует поддержка контроллера и виртуальной реальности ( для которой требуется определенный девайс), а также есть тут и карточки с достижениями. Игра воистину хороша,но и цена на нее соответствующая. Скидка никогда не повредит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120175415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1472146904}
review:
Как многие уже писали - игрушка в жанре Tower Defense. Я люблю подобного рода игры. Не только на ПК, но и на андроиде, к примеру. Но эта игра имеет еще и тег "стратегия". Как выяснилось - City Defense - это еще и стратегия в реальном времени.
По началу игра показалась немного медленной, но стоило только развиться, как она стремительно начала разрастаться. Очень много того, чего можно сделать. Необходимо учитывать экономику, чтобы создавать юнитов, улучшать строения, исследовать новые технологии. Однако, как было замечено, достаточно развитить все почти до максимума, и игра переходит в режим "Выживай так долго, как только сможешь".
Да, возможно игра не отличается чем-то уникальным, революционным и новым, но для поклонников жанра она определенно придется по душе. Цена вполне приемлимая, имееются коллекционные карты, достижения и поддержка Окулус Рифт.
Как по мне, игра стоит того, чтобы на нее обратили внимание. Было бы удобно еще получить мобильную версию такой игры. В любом случае, рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044469409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1472179805}
review:
Всегда любил игры связанные с тематикой Зомби-Апокалипсиса, только не всегда разработчики могут реализовать потенциал данной тематики в своих играх. В данном продукте они смогли это сделать, хоть по моему мнению и не совсем полностью.
Как всегда наша задача в играх такой тематики- выжить, ну и попутно настрогать на суши столько зомби,сколько сможем. Игра является стратегическим товер дефенсом с элементами виртуальной реальности. По сюжету нам необходимо удерживать определенные точки на локациях вырабатывая определенные ресурсы и защищаясь от нашествия мертвяков. Игра приближена к реализму и для успешного выживания необходимо быстро реагировать и адаптироваться к таким составляющим как непредсказуемость погоды и условия окружающего ландшафта,а также по максимуму использовать эти составляющие для своего блага, правильно выбирая вид сооружений,вооружения,техники и пехоты. В игре 16 миссий, которые можно проходить на различных уровнях сложности. Чем выше уровень сложности - тем больше очков развития мы получим.
Что касается технических параметров, то игра хорошо оптимизирована и пойдет даже на слабых ПК, при этом выдавая отличное качество картинки (графики). Поддерживается Элементы виртуальной реальности (шлемак) и контроллер, также есть поддержка русского языка интерфейса.
В целом за свою цену разработчики предоставляют нам довольно хороший товар, который я однозначно порекомендовал бы любителям такого жанра игр.

review: Необычная графика с добавлением виртуальной реальности делают проект довольно специфической товер-дефенс стратегией. Однако, если бы модели окружающего города и орды зомбаков были лучше (более реалистичнее, не просто в виде иконок) проработаны, то от игры бы было не отлипнуть. Музыка отлично поддерживает атмосферу напряжённости, в купе с нашими действиями по удержанию точек и выработки необходимых ресурсов. С учётом, что ведутся постоянные апдейты игры, ставлю проекту 7 баллов из 10.

Ваша задача заключается в том чтобы любой ценой защищать города с нормальными, здоровыми людьми. Данная игра даёт возможность использовать практически всё вооружение которое существует на данный момент. В огромный выбор как и класса пехоты так и большой выбор техники, так же присутствует ядерное оружие что как бы впечатляет. Данная игра предоставляет нам компанию из 16 миссий которые становятся всё сложнее и сложнее. По мимо того что у нас огромный выбор людей, тут много видов зомби которые отличаются своими умениями.

Графика в игре довольно таки не плохая и очень нравятся тёмные тона, глазам легче. Звуковое сопровождение эффектов на высоком уровне. Багов и проблем не было!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114294778', 'num_games_owned': 6406, 'num_reviews': 301, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1472046214}
review:
Zombie City Defense 2 - tactical strategy, where you try to defend the city from the hordes of zombies. All you have in the beginning is your base and several basic units and your ultimate goal is to survive zombies assault waves as long as you can and protect your general, who is in the main building, by improving the base and units, scouting abandoned buildings and destroying infested ones.

During the mission you control the base and units in a real time. All the units have several upgrades and between the missions you can also research new types of units, upgrades and perks by spendind tactical points - special resource you obtain after finishing the missions. There are 3 difficulties with additional infinity mode to see how long  you can survive under constant zombies assault.

The graphics is simple (no unit models, icons only), but it's still good. The gameplay is rather hard  at first, when there are a lot of different icons on a map, but after several missions you'll get used to it. There are steam trading cards and achievments in the game.

I liked Zombie City Defense 2 and think that it is a nice tactical strategy, so i recommend it to anyone, who likes zombie-themed tactical strategies.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198110829497', 'num_games_owned': 6641, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1472374251}
review:
[h1]intro.[/h1]
i need to confess, when i got interesting in a game, i thought it just a new tower defense game -
i like to play tower defense games; both on computer and on mobile - and when i started to play it - it appeared to be tower defense game on steroids - actually a real time strategy game!

[h1]this is RTS![/h1]
yes, later i saw the intro video more carefully, and its stated there; yes, "strategy" is among tags;
but i just want to point your special attention to the fact that in case of this game, these statements are made not just for boasting, not just to interest more gamers'  - game is indeed an RTS.

[h1]Design[/h1]
i'm not sure i've ever played rts without animated characters - in Zombie City Defense 2 the units you make are not funny toy soldiers you've used to in most games, but rather schematical in design what makes the game look like a grand strategy - however, it does not make the GAME worse, and - it does not make the GAMING worse - minimal design of units you operate with goes well with overall minimal thoroughful interface design.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
There are lots of things to do, and when the game seemed a bit slow to me at first, i realized its rather fast when developed a little - units pace must be kept in accordance with economy, and economy should build new units, upgrade buildings, explore new technologies and we have a very vast structure of all these things plus levels with different tasks - scavenge, survive, clean the city etc. After you've covered everything you have "Infinite mode" when you can play as long as you only can survive.

[h1] Verdict [/h1]
Honestly, I didn't expect this game to be this great. I did not expect small indie team to make a project of this quality with an interesting gameplay, new ideas in uniting the genres, fresh approach to UI and overall design, even the quality everything is made with. I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007622363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1471896200}
review:
Great idea with many different unit types for both the zombies and the player. My biggest issue is the AI's pathfinding. It is not dynamic enough to be fun for more than 20-30 miuntes. After you notice how the zombies go to the closest units ("as the crow flys") you can easily fight them off. Even though there is an infinite mode for the game, it is still not fun. It will turn into blob against blob until there are no more people to rescue and use. I'm not a fan of tower defense games and this is what this game feels like. If you were looking for more rts and less tower defense this game is not for you. If you enjoy the slow/fast turtle defense with waves of enemies like a tower defense game this game is for you.

My suggestion to the developer, change the pathfinding up on the waves. So, the zombies arent just going to the closest target.

review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Bei Zombie City Defense handelt es sich um ein Strategiesches Verteidigungsspiel bei dem man als Hauptziel einen General in der eigenen Basis verteidigen muss. Je nach Schwierigkeitsgrad gibt es verschiedene Haupt/Optioniale Ziele wie z.B X Tage überleben, bestimmte Gebäude X Tage zu halten oder eine bestimmte Menge an Materialien am Ende der Spielzeit zu besitzen.
Momentan besitzt das Spiel 16 Missionen bei welchen man teilweise seine Strategie stark umstellen muss um diese zu bestehen. Jede Mission ist in 3 Schwierigkeitsgraden spielbar und im Endlosmodus.
Zum Verteidigen stehen einem verschiedene Soldaten, Perks, Fahrzeuge, Turrets, Gebäudeverbesserungen zur verfügung von denen man die meisten erst freischalten muss durch Punkte welche man im Spiel verdient, was jedoch relativ schnell geht.
Das Spiel selbst spielt in einer Art Infrarotansicht einer Spionagesonde. Während des spielens muss man verschiedene strategische Gebäude einnehmen um Ressourcen zu generieren und die Stadt nach Überlebenden durchsuchen lassen um seine Streitmacht zu vergrößern. Mit diesen Einheiten und verschiednen anderen Hilfen muss man dann die Ziele erreichen. Man kann bei jeder Mission nur eine gewisse Anzahl an Einheiten mitnehmen, man besitzt ein gewisses Punktelimit und muss sich vor Missionsbeginn entscheiden welche Einheiten Typen man mitnimmt.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
- Alle Gebäude zerstörbar
- Strategie wichtig
- großer Wiederspielwert
- Gut Balanced
- Wenig Bugs (Keiner davon Spielbeeinflussend)
- Aktive Devs

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Teilweise momentan noch etwas unübersichtlich (Besonders im Endlomodus anch ca 40 Wellen)
- Controllersteuerung meineserachtens nicht gelungen (Lieber Keyboard und Maus)
- Leider keine Deutsche Oberfläche/vertonung

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Ein tolles strategisches Verteidigungsspiel welches noch ein paar kleine Fehler besitzt welche aber sicher bald von den sehr aktiven Devs gefixt sind. Für Strategiefans absolut zu empfehlen, auch zum Vollpreis

author: {'steamid': '76561198014443317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1546289158}
review:
[h1]Zombie City Defense 2[/h1]

Well, it's fun. Short and sweet, but gets the point across. I'll go further into detail on each element that I think makes up this game. But, for those who don't like to read long-ish reviews, [b]I do recommend[/b] this game.

So, meat and potatoes...

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

It's somewhat of a different RTS, where you don't focus so much on the economy or base building, but more on the combat and strategy. Oh, but there is a bit of base building, and an economy to worry about. So, the economy. There will be building scattered around the map, most of them being inside the walls that make your base, that produce resources when you have a unit garrisoned inside it. Farms for food, factories for metal, apartments and bunkers for people, and labs/hospitals for medicine. Food is used to maintain your armies, metal for building, medicine for healing, and people to initally buy the unit. All of these resources are infinite, except for people. That has a limit built into each map, and makes it a touch more challenging to manage your armies. It's a good thing, though, as you can't just spam one unit and "zerg" the map.

Base building in this game is not placing buildings, but rather doing slight upgrades to buildings that already exist. Units can build fortifications inside their garrisons, or you can expand the buildings to add more room. Fortifying adds alot of defense to the units inside, while expanding allows you to fit one more unit inside, but without the extra defense that comes with fortifications.

Combat is fairly straight forward, each unit will have a red circle around it, when selected, that shows it's range. Units automatically fire upon any zombie in range, and so far, seem to always target the closest zombie. You can make them attack a different zombie if you want them too, and attacking a building requires you to (on kb and mouse) to hold down the right mouse button, or use a couple unit's abilities. Almost all commands are done with the right mouse button, click for move/attack, hold click to attack something that is non-hostile. Units can be levelled up, to a max of 5, which increases their overall stats. I'm not going to go into too much detail on the different units available, but I will say that you would do well to experiment on each mission to find the right set-up. You're limited on what you have access to build via "cards" that require TP (gained when completing a mission/objectives and killing zombs) to unlock. Each card has a command cost, and you're limited on how much "command" you have. So choose wisely.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

Nice, and different. It's like looking through a drone feed. No photo-realism here, just blue terrain and buildings, red icons for zombies, red building when occupied by zombz. Basically red is bad, blue is good. The interface is ok, and could use some tweaking, i.e, not having the starburst pattern lines all around, makes it look cluttered to me. Your view angle is directly tied to your zoom level, which I personally don't like. When zoomed in all the way, you're essentially looking down the road, and when zoomed all the way out, it's straight bird's eye view. I'd prefer to be able to orient the camera a full 360 degrees at all zoom levels.

[h1]Replayability[/h1]

Not really existent. I mean, you can replay missions to get more TP, adjust strategies and test new units, but once you have completed all three difficulties for each mission, there's not really anything else to do.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

It's a good game, great for killing a bit of time. It has a decent amount of depth without being overwhelming, and if you like strategy, but want something a bit faster paced than say, Hearts of Iron, then this one's for you. Good for pick up and play, can start it up, do a couple missions, and walk away. You can also marathon longer sessions with "Infinite" mode, see how long you can last!

I wholeheartedly recommend this game, it's cheap, and fun. Like video games should be.

review:
«Zombie City Defense 2» тактическая стратегия в реальном времени с схематичной (упрощенной) графикой. Игра мне чем-то напомнила довольно известную «Plague Inc Evolved», в которой нам надо было заразить весь мир. В этой же игре напротив – нам предстоит спасать мир после того, как он заразился вирусом зомби. Нам предстоит создавать оплот человечества, строить укрепленные города, собирать ресурсы, создавать армии и искать выживших. Выбор авторами схематичной графики делает эти две игры очень похожими, не смотря на совершенно противоположенный сюжет.

Описывать геймплей долго и нудно, поэтому советую посмотреть видео, а когда будете играть не пропускайте обучение. Игра поддерживает русский язык, что очень радует. Поэтому с обучением у вас не должно возникнуть никаких трудностей.

Конечно графика очень упрощена, но тут делают упор именно на стратегическую часть игры. Вам надо просчитывать каждый шаг, тратить ресурсы очень разумно. В игре есть четыре уровня сложности (легкий, мастер, хардкор и бесконечный), 15 видов пехотинцев (инженер, разведчик, солдат, медик, огнеметчик и т.д.),17 видов транспорта, а также такие способности, как авиаудар, напалм, ядерный удар, кислотная бомба и т.д. (всего 9 способностей). Здания можно взрывать используя динамит, артиллерию или бомбардировщики. Тут 9 видов зомби, меняются погодные условия и рельеф местности.

Игра поддерживает Oculus Rift and dual-pad контроллер, имеются карточки и достижения.
Интересная инди-стратегия про постапокалиптический мир зомби. В нее стоит попробовать сыграть!

review:
Красивая стратегическая игра с элементами tower defense. Вам предстоит взять под свой контроль оборону города от наплыва зомби. Помимо защиты, вам будут поручать различные задания, в том числе, полную очистку города. Используйте ландшафт и большие здания для организации надежной обороны своей базы. Следите за местностью, предугадывайте возможные направления атак. Старайтесь собрать как можно больше ресурсов, это поможет создать хорошую армию и дальше продвигаться по миру в поисках выживших, новых ресурсов и ответов на вопрос, что же вызвало пандемию.

В игре красивая графика, достойная озвучка присутствуют достижения и коллекционные карточки. Для любителей виртуальной реальности в игре есть такая возможномость. Так же есть поддержка контроллера.

Все бы не чего, но вот русский язык я включить не смог, я то его включил, но после того на начал новую игру - игра была на английском, но я думаю, что разработчик скоро исправит эту проблему.

Рекомендовано всем любителям стратегий и TD.

review:
Zombie City Defense 2 - это сиквел игры с мобильных девайсов. Жанр игры - крутой коктейль из RTS и tower defense. Цель игры - защитить город от нашествия зомби, пораженных вирусом. Во время прохождения будут предлагаться дополнительные интересные миссии по очистке города и прочее. В защите нам поможет ландшафт, различные строения, спецспособности, пехота и техника.
Графика игры, несмотря на мобильное наследие, хороша. Да, она схематична (более типична для глобальных стратегий), но это тоже очередная изюминка игры. Что сказать про звук - ничего выдающегося, но и плохим звуковое оформление не назовешь. Вердикт: игра - крепкий середнячек и, учитывая то, что конкурентов в жанре у игры по сути нет, рекомендую к ознакомлению.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024210189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1471720563}
review:
Обзор писался, проведя в игре чуть более 4,5 часа. Так сказать первые впечатления =)) 
Прошёл многократно, первые 2 миссии на сложности Хардкор (чуть ниже опишу почему), ну и плюс обучение. 
Сюжет игры и смысл, пересказывать не буду, это всё можно прочесть и посмотреть выше...
И так, в начале каждой миссии, Мы выбираем чем будем сражаться, какими будем пользоваться юнитами, техникой, улучшениями, способностями и т.д. и т.п. Всеми сразу нельзя, есть определенное количество слотов, которые можно использовать. Для открытия нового юнита, техники, способности... необходимы Тактические Очки (ТО). Они выдаются после прохождения миссии, чем выше сложность миссии - тем больше ТО. Каждую миссию можно проходить многократно, тем самым накапливая ТО для открытия новых юнитов, техники и т.д. и т.п. 
В самой игре есть 4 вида ресурса:
* Еда - добывается немного в командном центре, много на фабрике(заводе) и мало развед отрядом - необходимо для питания юнитов и техники.
* Механизмы - добывается немного в командном центре, много на фабрике(заводе) и мало развед отрядом - необходимо для постройки юнитов, техники и турелей.
* Пилюли - добывается немного в командном центре, много на фабрике(заводе) и мало развед отрядом - необходимо для лечения юнитов, техники и турелей.
* Люди - добывается развед отрядом - необходимо для постройки юнитов, техники и турелей.
В первых двух миссиях необходимо было продержаться определенное количество времени, плюс захватить и удержать определенную точку или уничтожить что либо. У некоторых юнитов, есть свои способности, у развед отряда есть взрывчатка, ею можно взорвать здание... 
В зависимости от стратегии и тактики, можно сбалансировать команду и выносить мобов на раз два. Главное, в начале каждой мисии ВНИМАТЕЛЬНО осмотреть карту и наметить основные точки для захвата и расположения юнитов и турелей. В первую очередь ОБЯЗАТЕЛЬНО изучить улучшение РАСШИРЕНИЕ! Оно позволяет добавить +1 дополнительный слот в здании для юнита. 2 снайпера (вместо 1) на вышке, или 2 (вместо 1) Противотанковых отряда в Доте - ой как облегчат жизнь на миссии. Это не говоря, что инженеров, в добывающем здании, можно впихнуть на 1 больше.

 К сожалению есть баги, но Они незначительные. 
* Если начинаете новую игру и у Вас сменился Русский язык на Английский - войдите на миссию и здайтесь, когда откроется основное меню, выберите Русский язык и нажмите - Продолжить. 
* Если у вас есть джойстик, игра предложит выбор на чем хотите играть, на мышке + клавиатура или на джойстике. При выборе первого варианта, игра предложит нажать на кнопку А, она не работает, жмите Enter.

В целом, игра понравилась, поставил бы оценку 8/10.

review:
I will be recommending this game. I will also be refunding it.

In a period in my life where $10 is a very important figure for me, I cannot use it on this game. Sure it's $10, but for $10 I expect a little bit more than what this game gave me, but not much.

To save you the read, you should definitely pick this game up when it's on sale. Install this on a laptop and you'll be having fun on a flight, or even as a means of killing half an hour in time.

--

The art style is 'militaristic' which fits this game well. There are a small amount of gripes however, one of which being that you can be confused where to click in order to select a unit. Unit icons in this game are rather small, however dragging to select works just fine. A minor gripe but a gripe none the less.

The title of the game gives you exactly what it says, but that's it. It has the story of a mobile game, and that is probably because the first game in this series is just that. For $10 I'd expect a little more, but that's just me, and I know people who would not mind one bit. That's all this game really is to me. It's just not 100% me. I bought this game because defense games is 100% me.. But this one isn't. It's not all there for me, but for a sale I will be rebuying this game.

Mission times last 15 in game days, or in otherwords, around 10-15 minutes. That's why I say it would be a great time killer, because you feel progress fast. That's not my preference. Thankfully there's an infinite time game mode, but it's rather futile considering enemies get increasingly harder, the 10-15 minute mark won't be seeing much more time added onto it.

The game has typos but is generally fully functioning. I encounter no bugs in the 1 hour of consecutive gametime I gave this game. 

I recommend it, it's just not 100% me. Probably 70%, and that's why Ill be rebuying on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123499864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1476203195}
review:
[h1]Внимание! Обзор содержит моё личное мнение о продукте.[/h1]
Zombie City Defense 2 — качественно выполненная стратегия в реальном времени. По сюжету, в ближайшем будущем человечество подвергается действию вируса, который превращает население в монстров, не контролирующих своё тело и разум. Вы же являетесь управляющим компании Iron Corps, от действий которого зависит исход «войны». Сможете ли вы выжить? Хватит ли времени, чтобы вывести антидот и спасти мир? Время покажет.
В самом начале игры обязательно пройдите обучение, оно длится буквально пять минут, никаких занудных текстов читать не требуется, немного слов и практика, зато вопросов по начальным действиям не появится.
Разработчики вложили неоценимое количество усилий в данный проект. Только подумайте, вам доступно 15 различных солдатов, начиная обычными инженерами и заканчивая огнемётчиками, до 17 единиц техники, это и туррели, и танки, и бронированные бульдозеры, и артиллерия. Есть возможность улучшения зданий от обычных баррикад до командных центров. Доступны для изучения перки и контрольные удары, такие как воздушный удар, ядерный взрыв и так далее.
Каждая локация соответствует определенной зоне(зараженная, обычная, с присутствием радиации, избытком лесов и низкими температурами) имеет свои уникальные особенности: погодные условия, рельеф, количество ресурсов и свободной земли. Всего доступно 16 миссий, каждая из которых требует определенного стиля игры и уклонения в нужное русло. Имеется 3 уровня сложности (обычный, мастер и хардкор), чем выше сложность - тем больше очков для улучшений вы получаете. К тому же можно опробовать бесконечный режим, который покажет, как долго вы сможете удержать натиск заражённых. 
Совет: всегда берите максимум от полученной территории. Города с небоскребами дают хороший обзор для снайперов, территория с высокой плотностью позволит забаррикадироваться так, что даже подобраться никто не сможет, промышленные территории склонны к добыче ресурсов, а земли с мостами помогут вам притормозить нашествие заражённых, просто подорвите переправу к чертям. Необходимо каждый раз продумывать свои действия, без этого никак. Только имейте в виду, ночью зомби преимущественно сильнее, их намного тяжелее убить. 
Идём дальше. Если вы боитесь, что игра у вас не запустится, всё напрасно. Zombie City Defense 2 хорошо оптимизирована, даже с Intel Core 2 Duo и 2 ГБ ОЗУ у вас получится поиграть в этот шедевр, уверяю. 
Это, пожалуй, первый раз когда я жалею, что у меня отсутствует VR шлем, в ближайшие выходные собираюсь взять у знакомого и попробовать его на данном продукте. Mozg Labs позаботились и о достижениях, которые продлят наслаждение стратегией и добавят некий челлендж.
Подведём итоги. Zombie City Defense 2 я бы порекомендовал каждому, как минимум на пробу, такая игра никого не разочарует, даже если вы ненавистник RTS жанра. Смесь хорошего геймплея, разнообразие действий и активностей, при этом присутствует некий сюр. Я очень доволен.

review:
Note: This review is for the beta (pre-release) version.

The first thing that grabbed me about Zombie City Defense 2 is the way it looks. It's a very good looking game - it doesn't have the most sophisticated graphics card-killing effects, but it looks beautiful. It reminds me of Defcon a bit. The next thing I liked is that it's a one-handed game - you can play the entire game from the mouse.

The game itself is a mixture of RTS and tower defence. You create and control a bunch of units whose job it is to scavenge and secure the landscape. There's a nice balance to the game in that your strategy has to be measured. You can expand into the surrounding buildings quickly in order to grab resources and place units in strategic locations. But too much of this approach can leave your lines over-extended and vulnerable to attack. Or you can hunker down and defend what you have, meaning you'll gather less resources and risk being overwhelmed by later waves.

You can choose which difficulty to use on each level, which affects the amount of upgrade points you can gain. Those points can be used to unlock new units, etc. Choosing upgrades and perks can make a big difference to the game - getting artillery and vehicles alters your strategic approach.

It's an easy game to get into, but a hard one to master. There's some really nice balance to the gameplay and you can find the tide of a level switching on you rather suddenly. I don't think I'll be playing this one intensely, but I get a feeling that it's the kind of game I'm going to leave installed for a long time and keep coming back to it.
